intro: Chenopodium iljinii, commonly known as Iljin's goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers that appear in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Chenopodium iljinii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
